comment: I took this online during summer and I'd suggest everyone else do the same! Unbarable topic for a whole semester, very bland and boring. I enjoyed this having never had online classes before. Very simple to comprehend and the essay was my favorite part! Overall not too hard to do well! She is very clear and seems helpful! I learned a lot!!!!!!!!!!!

The single most helpful professor I have had as an undergrad. If you go to her she will help you and it will will help your grade alot. Overall the class is far from easy but not impossible. I wish I could have had her for a few other classes as I have learned a great deal from her.

Senior Seminar. Learned so much! Lot's of writing, but she doesnt grade as hard as she leads on. Lot's of interesting guest speakers. Don't be scared to take this class! You will learn so much about grad school, careers etc. Regular Attendance and Participation is 10% of your grade.She's very helpful and nice, I wish I had another class with her!

This is a must-take class as an online 2-week(8 days, 3 hours/day) course.  The subject was unbearable for me.  Dr. Patterson made what might have been 4 months of sheer heck a bearable two weeks.  Easy A if you put the time in.  I can't imagine spending 4 months with this material though. Don't torture yourself, do the two-week class for this one.

Online class is fantastic compared to other online classes.  Weekly lectures that are current and topical. Weekly quizzez on the material in the book and lecture and a weekly online discussion.  Be sure to answer you classmates at least a couple of times or your grade might suffer.  Great teacher, don't hesitate to take her.

Great professor; extremely helpful and very insightful. She loves Geography so it comes across in her teaching. Learned way more than I thought I would and was honestly amazed at how much I liked it. Would take her again without hesitation!

Some trick questions on her quizzes. She's pretty forgetful. I had to email her 5 times for 1 question because she kept forgetting to post the answer. Not a ton of work, but the work is pretty hard. Had to write a 4-5 page essay on "Urban sprawl." I can knock out a research paper with no sweat, but filling 4 pages on such a tiny subject was hard.

Great professor. Expect to be treated like an adult. She makes you accountable for your attitude and academics. Loves to pile on work, but expects communication from students if something is amiss. If you want to be respected, take her.

to the point!  she will not hand you an A.  but,  she will guide you in the right direction. you will get what you deserve.  so go in, do what you're supposed to and speak up in class = you'll be just fine.

Good professor. She comes off as a bit cocky at times, but she's a nice person. The class is fairly easy. A few quizzes, two tests, one term paper. Her participation policy is annoying. I was at every class and still got a 75 attendance grade because, apparently, I didn't talk enough during class discussions. Good class overall. Pretty informative.

I took her class online.  The test and assignments were easy.  Lot of reading, of course since it was online (a chapter a week).  Test had a time limit, but you could do them more than once.  It was all pretty easy until the final exam!  It was like 88 questions and timed.  Study for the final!!

She sucks!!! she calls on students without them raising there hands, then she gets a attitude when u cannot answer her questions. She gave us a dumb poster project that she barely helped us on. She came to class disorganized and with a attitude everyday!!! Dang, we are the students and u r the teacher...SO TEACH US!!!
wow...hmm...just don't do it if you can avoid it...all I can really say is I think she would rather be anywhere else OTHER than teaching her class

A lot of reading. Less than half of the reading is discussed in class but most of it is on the final.  The grades: 2 papers, attendance, a final. It seemed to me that we went over the same subject everyday. I felt like the class was a waist of time however I made an A. Go to class do the reading turn in papers on time then it is an easy A

Took Dr. Patterson for Maymester, very fast past class, no exams, one paper, 4 different learning modules. You have to answer 3 discussion posts and respond to 2 per module.  I thought the class was interesting.  Did not think I would learn much, but actually learned a great deal.  Must be comitted to do well in the class. I got an "A:

To be fair, she gave us the chance to redeem our first essay grade by letting the second essay grade replace the first.  If you didn't do as well on the second essay, then you got the lower grade.  She wasn't being mean, just consistent.

Dr. Patterson comes across as a fun teacher and a great person. Which she is. However, she is very demanding. It is impossible to get a good grade on a paper. She is very cocky. She "said" that if you want to make you first paper better than make a better grade on your second. She lowered my first to match my second. This  gave me a TERRIBLE GRADE!

this was the most ridiculous class ever, the people that rate her as a good teacher are freshmen that are still in the "group project" phase. she lectured 5 days and relied on project presentations every other class. it was ridiculous and a waste of my time. she's very loudly under the false impression that she's the smartest professor at ks

I have had Dr. Patterson for most of my Geog classes. She is awesome! Very understanding and helpful when you ask. You have to work for your grades and in the long run you will appreciate it.If you are just looking to slack off and not be involved then don't take the class. but if you want. Her stories are GREAT and you will learn a lot!

BAD teacher! she cant teach! you have to go to class. she is one of the worst teachers i have ever had! i dont know one person that made better than a C. she gives very hard test and for her quizes b.s.

She is exactly as she says, someone on here complained about her comment on not giving A's... that's correct, however she will allow you to EARN an A. Read the material, know her lectures and you will be just fine.
Liked her and the class, but this one you will have to work at and read the book, she doesn't make it really easy on you. She seems to have a good heart and cares about social issues, I like her.

If you wish to grow as a person  as well as intellectually do not miss out her class. If you have the opportunity to take Dr.Patterson consider your self lucky. Spent the summer with the Dr. as a study abroad to Argentina; it changed my life. I am forever greatfull

a little scary, i'm going to admit. intimidating. but all that goes away... after the midterm. really nice lady, but won't just give you good grades if you suck up. you literally have to bust ass in this class. read the book! read the chapters! the maps! it's the difference between As and Fs on the quizzes!

Great course and great class.    How to get an A: Use webCT Skim the text before class Listen in class and take a copy of the lecture outline.  Note the points she emphasizes on the outline and write in the stuff she says "this is a good quiz question", duh!?  memorize the defs at chapters end and read the chapter before the quizes and exams.

I liked her. YOu do have to read some in the book to get info that is on the tests and quizes. But majority does come from the notes. you will have to study a lot and info can get confusing but make charts when you are studying for tests it makes things a lot easier on you.

Class was very interesting and clear. Was terrified of class from first week, but she's not as hard as she made it out to be. She posts all her notes online. All tests are straightforward multiple choice. You do have to study a lot (from her notes), but don't have to read the whole chapter like she says to at beginning of semester. Don't buy atlas.
She is very knowledgable about her material. Was not too hard, you do have to study a lot. She is extremely nice and willing to help if it is needed.
Hard class, but can be OK if you pay attention in class...study for your tests! Eay to talk to and nice to look at.
She is such a ****! She told us on the first day that she doesnt give A's. She is very hard and expects A LOT!!!!
Very easy vary fun class.  She breaks down the material and makes it fun and interesting.  Read listen in class the day of quizzes and you will be fine!!!
Too much info to learn

class is easy if you learn the stuff.  don't buy the atlas, she even tells you you don't need it.  i have the world regions book for sell for anyone taking this course spring 2006.  trecker@students.kennesaw.edu
Easy class.  Read a chapter a week, take a quiz, and take 2 exams.  You do the work, you'll get a good grade.

Mrs Patterson is a great teacher! No tests except midterm and final. only quizzes on each chapter but they are only like 20 questions and like 10 map questions. the mid was hard but her quizzes are real easy. i would def recommend her. and shes really nice!

Mrs.Patterson is one of the nicest and most educated professors I have ever had. She definatly knows her stuff. Quizzes can be tough and you must read the chapters and be in class to do well. Her class is intersting and not boring at all. She does have an attendance policy but I definatly reccomend her. She is awesome and willing to help her studen
teacher is really nice and class is very interesting. no tests but attendance is required. only grades were two papers- so it can be good or bad.
